message.raw:
refs #484

Changed base unit of novatech to Hz. This should now mean that frequency calibrations will work in both labscript and BLACS for novatechs.

Hardware unit is still in terms of MHz or multiples of 0.1Hz depending on whether the novatech is being programmed in static or buffered mode.

message.raw:
Made an attempt at fixing issue #471.
The abort flag is now passed all the way to the acquisition thread, which checks it before raising an exception upon timing out. During an abort, we must wait up to five seconds for the acquisition call to time out before we can stop the task.
This *should* all go smoothly now :). Requires testing.

message.raw:
Modified extract_measurements in ni_pcie_6363.py. For an acquisition specified in labscript via (start_time, end_time, acquisition_rate), data is extracted such that:
* the first data point corresponds to the first analog sample after or at start_time,
* the last data point corresponds to the last analog sample strictly before stop_time,
* the time increments are 1/acquisition_rate,
* the absolute time of the data is accurate to +/- 5ns plus clock drift and accumulated PB edge errors (this takes into account the Analog Sample Clock Timebase delay of 20-30ns).
This also fixed a bug where len(times) != len(values)

message.raw:
Fixed a bug where aborting the NI 6363 caused a crash as it would execute transition_to_static in the acquisition process. This included post-processing of traces, which don't exist if an abort is happening.

Now the abort flag is passed to the acquisition process so that it knows whether to do this post-processing or not

message.raw:
Modified Calibrations name to Unit conversions
Renamed "connected to" to "parent port" in connection table and related code

Added a UnitConversionBase class which handles order of magnitude conversions (eg to p,n,u,m,k,M,G,T SI-prefixes) automatically. Just make your conversion class a subclass of UniConversionBase and pass you conversion a 'magnitudes' dictionary key with the value containing a list of prefixes as strings (eg {'magnitudes':['k','G'],...})
message.html:
Modified Calibrations name to Unit conversions
Renamed "connected to" to "parent port" in connection table and related code

Added a UnitConversionBase class which handles order of magnitude conversions (eg to p,n,u,m,k,M,G,T SI-prefixes) automatically. Just make your conversion class a subclass of UniConversionBase and pass you conversion a 'magnitudes' dictionary key with the value containing a list of prefixes as strings (eg {'magnitudes':['k','G'],...})

message.raw:
Fixed colour scheme of buttons!

Hover colours now make sense. Colour scheme can be adjusted via the blacs.gtkrc file

Implemented locking for Digital widgets properly. This locking doesn't actually set the widget insensitive, as we need the widget to respond so we can unlock it again! We do a bit of hackery to achieve this, and we need to make sure that we:

A) Don't accidentally program the device to the opposite of the locked value, and program it back (digital edges are bad!)

B) Locked digital widgets update themselves correctly when using the set_state method at the end of the experiment!

Further testing along these lines indicates that the program method gets called even when a widget is locked, but at least it is never asked to program the wrong value (it only ever programs the locked value)

I still need to implement the restoring of the locked state of a widget!

message.raw:
Removed print statements from main.pyw and front_panel_settings.py

Fixed error handling of step size adjustment dialog when an invalid number was given. Added functionality so that hitting enter submits the dialog (equal to clicking OK)

Added right click context menu to spinbutton up/down buttons. This also prevents the default behaviour of the up/down buttons, which is to set the spinbutton to it's upper or lower limit respectively.

For those reading this log, I've also discovered that middle clicking the up/down button adjusts the spinbutton value by the "page size" which is always set to 10 times the step size.

message.raw: Fixed bugs in NI 6363 buffered mode. Discovered that buffered mode fails if there is no digital output in the labscript run, this is because the PFI used for clock ticks never gets freed from its current task. Stopping the task regardless of whether there is buffered DO doesn't seem to help, in order for the PFI to become available it appears another digital task actually needs to start. That doesn't make sense, so I'll look into it. We should be able to free the PFI without having to start a fake DO task, overriding the manual mode values.

That doesn't make sense, so I'll look into it. We should be able to free the PFI without having to start a fake DO task, overriding the manual mode values.

message.raw:
Now moved BLACS opening/closing to use the new settings format.

This may be very very broken at the moment, so I suggest not using this revision unless you know what you are doing.

Restore from settings h5 file should approximately work, though I haven't tested the logic yet so bad states could potentially be restored if the connection table has changed. Will test soon.

Theoretically the pulseblaster should restore its freq/amp/phase widget values (doesn't restore units or step size yet)

message.raw:
Fixed up glade file scrollbar policy. Hopefully they won't suddenly always appear again.

Modified pulseblaster variable names to be more consistent with other classes

Modified the name/channel passed to AO/DO objects within a DDS object to better reflect what they are (in both the novatech and the pulseblaster)

Redesigned the save front panel state system to be within a separate object. This is only is use via the file->save option, and is currently untested.

Saving and loading at close and startup respectively still uses the old system and should not have changed.
